Package controllers

Class EffectController

java.lang.Object
controllers.Controller
controllers.EffectController
public class EffectController
extends Controller
EffectController facilitates the spawning and animation of effects in the game

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected java.util.LinkedList<Effect> effects
    The effects currently being shown
    protected java.util.LinkedList<Effect> effectsToRemove
    The effects to be removed after the next tick update
    protected java.util.LinkedList<Effect> effectsToSpawn
    The effects to spawn before the next tick cycle starts

    Fields inherited from class controllers.Controller

    gameInstance

  • Constructor Details

    • EffectController

      public EffectController​(SnakeGame g)
      Instantiates the EffectController and stores the SnakeGame instance for use later
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • spawnEffect

      public void spawnEffect​(Effect effect)
      Queues the effect instance to be spawned before next update tick
      Parameters:
      effect - The effect instance to be added
      See Also:
      update(double)

    • destroyEffect

      public void destroyEffect​(Effect effect)
      Queues the destruction of the effect instance provided. Will be destroyed after the next update tick has completed
      Parameters:
      effect - The effect instance to be destroyed
      See Also:
      update(double)

    • removeEffects

      private void removeEffects()
      Removes all Effect instances queued for destruction
      See Also:
      effectsToRemove, destroyEffect(Effect), update(double)

    • spawnEffects

      private void spawnEffects()
      Spawns all queued Effect instances
      See Also:
      effectsToSpawn, spawnEffect(Effect), update(double)

    • update

      public void update​(double dt)
      This method is called at the start of an update tick. First, any queued effects will be spawned. Then, active effects will be updated to advance the animation. Finally, any queued effects to be removed, will be removed.
      Parameters:
      dt - Measure of time since last update
      See Also:
      spawnEffects(), removeEffects()

    • redraw

      public void redraw()
      Requests each registered effect to redraw itself.
